translated: “There are no gods, it seems, and no one who can protect;

original: Na hi nūna santi idha lokapālā;
analyzed: na hi nūna santi idha lokapālā
translated: There are no guardians of the world, it seems,
Because those who act rashly, without restraint,
Have no one to stop them.”
“It rains for him at the wrong time,
and doesn’t rain for him at the right time.
He falls from his heavenly state,
The Jewel-Thief Birth Story is the fourth.
